name: Mary Mc Chicken Pasta
description: Creamy chicken pasta with sun-dried tomatoes, parmesan, and fresh basil.
ingredients: 1/2 cup sun dried tomatoes, finely chopped
instructions: Season chicken with salt and pepper.
Add olive oil to a large skillet or pan (big enough to hold everything).
Over medium-high heat, sear the chicken about 5-6 minutes each side.
Once seared, set aside on a plate. Cut the chicken into strips - it's ok if it is not 100% cooked at this point. It will finish cooking in the sauce.
Add garlic and chopped sun-dried tomatoes over low heat for 1-2 minutes.
Add the chicken stock to deglaze the pan. Scrape up any bits (low heat).
Add back chicken and all spices - combine.
Simmer while pasta starts to cook.
Add parmesan cheese to the sauce.
Sauce should start to thicken in 5 to 10 minutes.
Add pasta to water - this should take about 2 minutes to cook.
Add pasta to chicken/sauce, combine thoroughly.
Add a few spoonfuls of pasta water (maybe a ladle).
Add fresh basil and rest of parmesan cheese.
